title: 16-Year-Old Girl Hospitalized In One-Vehicle Accident
content:
Grand Island, Neb. -- A 16-year-old girl, who remains unnamed, is being treated for minor injuries after her vehicle crashed into a ditch, rolled and ended up on the driver-side door. 
 
The incident occurred at 11 a.m. Thursday morning at the intersection of Wildwood Drive and 60th road. The girl was traveling southbound in a 2005 Chevy Cavalier on 60th road at the time. 
 
She was transported with minor injuries to CHI St. Francis after complaining about body pains. 
 
The Hall County Sheriff's Office says they are investigating the accident, even though they said they have no reason to believe speed or alcohol played a factor. 
 
Deputies say the young girl was still at the hospital as of 2:30 p.m. Thursday, but is expected to be released before the day is over.
